page.title: 17Gotherington Area - Churches
page.content: St. Martin De Tours Church,Woolstone was partly rebuilt in 1499, but there is no record of when it was first built.It was further reconstructed in 1873.The present building is mainly perpendicular. There is now only a Tower,Nave and Chancel.The Tower has a marked lean to the West and South.It holds a peal of six bells.There is an interesting life-size effigy of a priest on the floor, along the North wall.The church is used every day for worship. The Free Church was built in 1883 and is still going strong with services and Bible classes every week.It occupies a building in the centre of Gotherington. Stanley Pontlarge Church has fine Norman doorways to South and North.A pair of bells hang in the belfrey and there is a mass dial on the South wall
